natural solution: Writing the equation in exponential form gives us $2x-7 = 9^{\frac{3}{2}} = (9^{\frac{1}{2}})^3 = 3^3 = 27$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "log 9 (2 * x - 7) = 3 / 2"
shows  "x = 17"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Find $x$ if $\log_9(2x-7) = \dfrac{3}{2}$. The final Answer is 17
 ### Proof
 Writing the equation in exponential form gives us $2x-7 = 9^{\frac{3}{2}} = (9^{\frac{1}{2}})^3 = 3^3 = 27$.
 Solving $2x-7=27$ gives us $x = \boxed{17}$
 *)

theorem
fixes x :: real
assumes h0 : "log 9 (2 * x - 7) = 3 / 2"
shows  "x = 17"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
